content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Phoebe is at the sink and Chandler is looking at a ring brochure.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs, can you help me pick out an engagement ring for Monica? I can’t figure this out! It’s so hard! Should I get her a (turning to each page) Tiffany cut or a Princess cut or a—ah-ah! Paper cut!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now, have you told anyone else?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I don’t want to tell anybody else because I don’t want Monica to find out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You told me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s because I trust you, you’re one of my best friends, and you walked in on me when I was looking at ring brochures.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah well, once again not knocking pays off. I only wish you hadn’t been on the toilet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Me too.
(Joey and Ross enter causing Chandler to quickly hide the brochure behind his back.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. (Heads straight for the fridge.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! So Chandler, wanna go to the coffeehouse?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh all right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, coffeehouse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh perfect, we were just gonna see if you wanted to go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh well, we don’t because we got…the…other pl-place.
(Joey returns with a piece of pizza as Chandler and Phoebe exit.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How rude.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. You wanna bite? (Holds his piece out for him.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So how are things going with Paul?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good. Although y’know, he-he’s a private guy. Y’know, I wish I could get him to open up a little bit, share some feelings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s easy! You just have to think of him as a-as a jar of pickles that won’t open.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what are you saying; I should run him under hot water and bang his head against a table?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No that’s what you do when you want to get the truth out of someone.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Hi honey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Watch this.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: How are you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Paul!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Hi Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So how are things going with you?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Can’t complain.
(Phoebe turns to Rachel and mimes remove a lid of a jar. Ross enters and Paul motions for Rachel to leave with him now.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Come on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Gets up and starts to leave with Paul.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!
(They shake hands and their lines overlap.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great to see you!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Good to see you too!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How you doing?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Good. Bye! (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! You take care!
(Ross turns his back on Paul and makes a ‘I hate that guy’ face. Paul does the same thing.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs, what-what was the deal with you and Chandler blowing us off before?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! That was so weird, huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, why’d you do it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I didn’t do it! It was Chandler! He’s… He’s mad at you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! Why?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please, I think you know why.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t think of anything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on Ross, you’re a paleontologist, dig a little deeper.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute, is it because Joey and I didn’t invite him to that Knicks game a couple of weeks ago?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do you think that’s something that he’d be mad at you for?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I guess it could.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well then I think that’s it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, if he’s angry, he really shouldn’t just cover it up. I-I wish he would just tell me the truth.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, if that’s what you want you then you really should run his head under hot water and bang his head against a table.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Paul and Rachel are getting ready to go out. Paul is entering from the bathroom.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Honey I made a reservation at China Garden, is that okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah that’s great. But first, wait, talk to me, talk to me. Tell me about your day.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: It was fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Hey, what are you thinking? What are you thinking right now?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I’m thinking that you are looking really fine it that dress.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah that’s great Paul, but y’know I wanna know what—(Puts her hands on his shoulders)—Wow, those are really great! I just wanna know what, what is behind this-this strong, silent exterior. Y’know they say that still waters run deep and I wanna swim in yours.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Are you talking about having sex?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Paul, I don’t know anything about you! Y’know, like-like your childhood! Tell me about your childhood!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Normal.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, well then how about puberty! Come on, that’s always a painful time! Y’know your friends invite you to a slumber party and then they stick your hand in warm water while you’re sleeping so that you pee in your sleeping bag.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Nope! That never happened to me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you’re lucky you never met that bitch Sharon Majesky. Anyway, umm… The rest of you life, y’know? Any regrets?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right Paul, I’m not asking for a lot here. Okay? Just give me something. Anything!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: When I was six years old.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hm-mmm.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I wanted a big wheel. And instead my parents got me this little plastic chicken that you hop around on. It was embarrassing; kids made fun of me. That was a pretty tough year.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s-that’s great! See? I already feel like I know you a little better! Thank you. Okay, come on. Now we can go eat. Let’s go. (Gets up to leave, but Paul doesn’t move.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: It was horrible. They called me chicken boy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!
[Time Lapse, Paul is now weeping uncontrollably in Rachel’s arms.]

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: And in fifth grade I got into a fight. Well, it wasn’t really a fight. Richard Darinvel bit me on the nose and, and I feel down. I still have a little scare right here (points to it) you can see it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, I-I-I see the scare. Listen, Paul, I think this is really great that-that y’know, you shared your feelings. It’s really, it’s beautiful, but umm, what do you say we go share some food?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Oh, I couldn’t eat now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Wait! What are you talking about?! You love their Kung Pao Chicken!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Chicken? (Pointing to himself.) Chicken boy!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My God, I’m sorry! I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to do that! I wouldn’t do that!
(Paul screams like a chicken and breaks down into tears again.)

content.description: A Jewelry Shop, Chandler and Phoebe are looking at engagement rings.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothin! This is the nine millionth ring store we’ve been too and I can’t find the perfect ring! (Goes over to another display counter and starts pointing at rings.) Ugly ring! Ugly ring! Ugly ring! (Notices that one of the jewelers is watching him.) It’s a beautiful selection. (The jeweler walks away slowly.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so maybe you don’t get her a ring. Maybe you-maybe you do something different. Y’know? Maybe you get her an engagement bracelet, y’know? Or an engagement tiara? Or—ooh! An engagement Revolutionary War musket! (Picks one up from the display in the corner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I’m so glad I picked you to help me with this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh? Can you just imagine getting down on one knee and handing her this gorgeous piece of weaponry?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m gonna stick with the ring. (Goes to another display counter.) Oh, this one’s nice! (Pointing to another ring.) I like this one! Sir? Uh, kind sir? Can I see this one?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait a minute, no, this is, this is the reason you brought me. Okay? I know how to haggle. So let me handle this from here on out.
content.parenthetical: coming over after returning the musket

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: Can I help you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-uh, yes. I would like to see that ring please.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or not, whatever.

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: This ring is from the 1920s, it’s a one and a half carat diamond with sapphires on either side.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sir, can I ask you to umm, could you…hold out that ring and ask me to marry you?

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: Okay. (Holds out the ring, deadpan.) Will you marry me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God that’s it, that’s the ring! How much is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler, I-I will handle this! (To the jeweler) How much is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We will give you $10.

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: Are you interested in this ring?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Yes, but I can only pay $8,000.

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: Okay, I can let it go at eight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We stand firm at $10.

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: How would you like to pay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, credit card. (Reaches for it then realizes) Oh no! No-no, but I left my credit card with Joey. (To Phoebe) Okay, I’ll go get it. You guard the ring.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (To the jeweler) Listen, I’m sorry about before. Do you have anything her for $10.

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: Uh yes, I have these two rather beautiful $5 bills. (Holds them up from his pocket.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ll give you $1 for them.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Joey are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, remember how Chandler and Phoebe blew us off yesterday?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Remember? You-you were eating pizza.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Well, apparently Chandler’s angry at us for not getting him a ticket to that Knicks game a couple of weeks ago.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, we’re supposed to just get him a ticket?! That guy is always mooching off of us!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Anyway, I-I still think we should try to patch things up, y’know? Like uh, maybe we could get him to get tickets to another Knicks game and invite him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh wow that’s a great idea! And I still have his credit card.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. (Starts to get his money)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey-hey-ho-ho, I got this one. Here you go. (Hands Gunther Chandler’s card.) Y’know I gotta tell ya, sometimes I just—I don’t get Chandler. Y’know, me and him do stuff all the time without you and you don’t get all upset.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All the time?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All the time!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is there as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Still crying?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Like a little girl. I know. I know. I know. This is all my fault; I wanted him to open up. But God, I didn’t know that I was gonna unleash this-this weepy, clingy, moist monster!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, I only know of two surefire ways to shut a man up. And one of them is sex.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s the other one?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know, I’ve never had to use the other one. I’m just saying y’know, if we’re having sex, he’s not gonna be talking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that’s right. You’re the talker. (They both reflect on that briefly) Anyway uh, great idea! Umm, I gotta go to the store; I told him that I would buy him some more tissues.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, we have some…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No you don’t!

content.description: The Jewelry Store, Phoebe is busy trying on virtually everything in the store. She’s got earrings, rings, bracelets, and enough necklaces to put Mr. T to shame on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay umm, I’d also like to try on the tiara. (The male jeweler hands it to her.) Oh yeah. Okay. (Puts it on.) (To the jeweler) What do you think, too much?

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: A tad.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Then, take the tiara back and let me hold the musket again. (He hands it to her and Phoebe poses in front of one of those small mirrors.) Something’s missing. It’s not… Okay oh, let me see the ring my friend picked out.

content.speaker: Male Jeweler
content.text: Where’s the 1920s princess cut ring.

content.speaker: Female Jeweler
content.text: I just sold it to that gentleman. (Points to the one walking out the store.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!! (She runs after him, but sets of the security system, which locks the store’s door and brings down a set of bars behind her, caging her in.) No! What?! Help me! Let me out! Now! (Points the musket at them.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Paul is still crying as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Rachel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. How are ya Paul? (Starts to look for his credit card.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay. Chandler, did your dad ever hug you?
content.parenthetical: acting manly to try and cover up his crying

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, did he hug you?!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: No! No! It’s just that, my dad never did. I miss my dad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you can see my dad in Vegas kissing other dads.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Hey Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Would you……Would you hug me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m a little busy here Paul.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: That’s exactly what my dad used to say! (Starts to breakdown again.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, a quick one. Come on hug it out. (Paul rushes over and hugs Chandler tightly.) Oh hey! There you go. (The hug continues.) Okay. (The hug continues.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Five more seconds.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (Pushes him away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Joey! (Goes over and hugs Joey and picks him off of his feet.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa-hey-hey! (Motions to Chandler, “What’s going on?”) Hi, Paul is it? (Paul nods yes and still hugging Joey.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you have my credit card?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes, it’s in my… In…in my pocket. (Paul hasn’t dropped him yet.) (Chandler starts to reach for his front pocket.) My back pocket! My back pocket!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank God! (Grabs his card.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey listen I got us tickets to a Knicks game tonight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I can’t go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! It’ll be fun! Me, you, and Ross, and… Paul probably…

content.description: The Jewelry Store, Chandler is entering with his credit card and Phoebe is holding out another ring for him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler, I found the perfect ring. (Holding it out for her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s uh, that’s pretty nice but I’m gonna go with the one I picked first.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God Chandler, the one you picked is gone. It’s over!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Some guy bought it. I’m sorry. I tired to stop it but they (points to the jeweler) put me in jail!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They put you in jail?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The little jail between the doors!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe, I asked you to guard the ring!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, I’m sorry! But y’know, this ring is better! Monica never even saw the other ring.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah but when he proposed to me with the ring I got goose bumps.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe it was the guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was the ring!

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is on the couch and Joey is entering.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! So uh, was he excited about the tickets?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! He blew us off!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe it. (Pause) Can I tell you something? I’m a little mad at him now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can I tell you something? Me too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? He didn’t want to talk to us about being angry, well maybe we don’t talk to him at all !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooooh! Freeze him out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I like it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eh? We’ll show him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: From now on, it’s gonna be Joey and Ross, best friends. (They shake hands.) Okay! We’re gonna be the new Joey and Chandler.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Paul is writing something as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. I’m back.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Hey! I have so much more to tell ya, I’ve written it all down!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah that’s great. No actually that’s… (In a sexy voice) That’s great! That’s really great! Y’know, I gotta tell ya writing, I mean writing, gets me uh, gets me kinda hot.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Wait! Wait! Listen! Listen to this! (Flips a couple pages and points to something.) Y’know what I wanted to be when I was that age?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A lover?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: A surfer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah surfer?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I wanted to be one with the waves, y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, hold on real quick, hold on a second let me just uh, (sits on the counter and buttons her sweater to show some cleavage) get a little more comfortable here. Wait, now wait a second, this isn’t too revealing is it?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: No. What ever happened to that little dude. (Pause) So full of dreams…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t care about the little dude! I can’t! I cannot listen to anymore of this! Y’know, the only person who would want to listen to this is a mental health professional! And then it’s only because they get paid $100 an hour! Do you know how much money I could’ve made listening to you? $2,000! And do you know when I figured that out? While you were talking!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: What?! I can’t believe you’re trying to stifle me! When just 14 hours ago we figured out that that is exactly what my mother was trying to do to me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh… I’m sorry. I… I-I don’t mean—I didn’t mean to stifle you. I… This is all just a little overwhelming.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Oh Rachel, I’m so sorry. I didn’t mean to overwhelm you. It’s just that, when those gates open, you… (Starts to breakdown.) Hard to close ‘em. But they are closed now. Believe me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m so glad, I’m so glad you shared. (Feeling his shoulder.) And I’m glad that you’re done. What do you say we umm… (Nods in the direction of the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I would really like that. (They kiss.)

content.description: Rachel’s Bedroom, Paul and Rachel are recovering.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: That was…so good. (Starts crying again.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is looking at the ring he bought and not liking it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe I let you talk me into buying this stupid gumball machine looking ring!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not a stupid gumball machine looking ring! It’s a beautiful ring!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it’s not! When I looked at the other ring I could see Monica’s face when I gave it to her, y’know? And I could see her saying yes. When I look at this ring, all I see is a ring! Unless I look at it really closely and then I can see my own eye. (Does so and laughs.) Look, this is the most important thing I’m gonna do in my life. I wanna make sure it’s perfect.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. There may be a way that we can get the other ring back. ‘Cause I heard the guy tell the jeweler where he was going to propose. So maybe we can get him to trade rings or something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t do that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well you certainly can’t give her that stupid gumball ring.

content.description: A Restaurant, Chandler and Phoebe are entering. This is the place where the guy who bought Chandler’s ring is going to propose.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There he is! (Points.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay and he hasn’t proposed yet because she has no ring on her finger.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! You’re good! After this, we should solve crimes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! Okay, go, go, go get him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay. (Walks over to him.) Excuse me sir? Could you come with me please? You have a phone call.

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: Who is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It is your office.

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: Do you know who at my office?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: John?

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: Oh John! Great!
(She brings him over to Chandler.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here he is.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! Hi. Okay, there was a slight mix-up at the jewelry store, the ring you’re about to propose with was supposed to be held for me. So, I’m gonna need to have that back. (The guy isn’t sure.) But, in exchange I’m willing to trade you this beautiful, more expensive ring. (Looking at the ring.) Ew.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! I would trade.

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: It is beautiful, but I’m gonna use this one. Now, if you’ll excuse me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no! This is my fiancee (Phoebe) and her heart was set on that ring. You don’t want to break her heart now do you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, do you want to break a dying woman’s heart?

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: You’re dying?!
(Phoebe coughs.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, she’s dying… Of a cough apparently.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, and it is my dying wish to have that ring. See, if I’m not buried with that ring then my spirit is going to wander the nether world for all eternity…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, that’s enough honey!

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: I don’t know. (Pause) Let me see the ring.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Great! Okay, here. (Holds the ring up for him.)

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: All right. (Exchanges rings.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you! (To his girlfriend) And you are about to marry a wonderful man! (She stunned and he’s horrified.) Hey! I’m marrying a dead woman!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Ross are watching TV as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guys? (They ignore him.) I’ve got something important to tell ya. (Still nothing so he walks over and stands in front of the TV.) Guys? (They lean over to try and watch the TV, Chandler mimics them.) Guys?! (Pause) I’m gonna ask Monica to marry me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think we gotta end the freeze out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute, is this, is this for real?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, check out the ring. (Shows it to them.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you two are really serious?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yep, pretty much.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You-you’re gonna get married?! I mean… We’re gonna be brothers-in-law! (They hug.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And-and-and-and-and-and, and we’re gonna be friends again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Heyyyy—What?
content.parenthetical: goes to hug him and stops short

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh it’s water under the bridge, forget it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (They hug.) I was gonna wait ‘til uh, it was official y’know? But I got so excited I just had to tell you guys because you’re my best friends.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think I’m gonna cry!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh! No more crying! Please! I just dumped one cry baby, I’ll dump you too!
(Ross and Joey urge Chandler to tell Rachel.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gonna ask Monica to marry me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh Chandler!! (Hugs him.) You guys are gonna be so happy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where’s all the tissues?! (Throws the box down in disgust.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, continued from earlier. Chandler is showing Rachel the ring.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Check out the ring.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nice! One and a half carat easy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler’s gonna ask Monica to marry him!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh I know, I helped pick out the ring.
(Chandler laughs, turns, and sees that Ross and Joey aren’t happy.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You told her before you told us?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, she walked in when I was looking at the ring brochures. You can understand that, right? (Ross and Joey look at each other and go back to watching the game on TV.) Guys? Guys? (Walks in front of them again.)
